nodes.text: Zeta Five was a Cha'a drone ship owned by Cha'a merchant lord Ssk Kahorr, who used the ship as a freighter. In 5000 BBY, the Zeta Five was sent on a run to deliver supplies and components to a mining colony on Goluud Minor, in the Goluud system. Kahorr chose to send the Zeta Five along the Goluud Corridor, a newly-discovered hyperlane that passed dangerously close to the system's unstable red giant star, Primus Goluud. The Zeta Five reached the Goluud system without incident but arrived to find Primus Goluud in a violent phase of stellar activity. The ship was subsequently destroyed by a massive solar flare, although not before it jettisoned its message pod, which had recorded the events regarding the ship's destruction.

The Zeta Five was a Cha'a drone ship and was used as a freighter. The ship was colored brown on the exterior, and on the top of the hull were three solar sails. The Zeta Five also had three engines located on its back end. On the underside of the ship, ten apparatuses protruded from the Zeta Five, five on each side. It did not require any sentient beings be aboard to operate it, and the navicomputer could calibrate hyperspace jumps by itself. The log was recorded in a Cha'a message pod, which would be jettisoned for later recovery if the ship was damaged or destroyed.

The Zeta Five was owned by Ssk Kahorr, a Cha'a merchant lord, as of 5000 BBY. The Zeta Five was usually docked in Cinnagar, the capital city of the planet Koros Major, where Kahorr based his operations. That year, Kahorr sent his ship to the Goluud system to deliver components and supplies to a new mining colony on Goluud Minor. Kahorr chose to send the Zeta Five on the Goluud Corridor, a recently-blazed hyperlane discovered by hyperspace explorers Gav and Jori Daragon, because the route was shorter than other possible options.

Despite the dangers of sending a ship along the route, which crossed perilously close to the Goluud system's unstable red giant star, Primus Goluud, Kahorr sent the Zeta Five on its way. The ship reached the Goluud system without incident; however, by the time the ship reached the system, Primus Goluud had entered into a particularly violent stage of solar activity. The ship was annihilated by a large solar flare, but was able to jettison its message pod. The message pod was later recovered by Kahorr, revealing to him the fate of the Zeta Five.
Like all drone ships, the Zeta Five did not require a sentient crew or pilot. The ship was owned by Cha'a merchant lord Ssk Kahorr.

The Zeta Five appears in Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi — The Golden Age of the Sith, a story arc of the Tales of the Jedi comic book series, written by Kevin J. Anderson and released in 1996. The ship makes its only appearance in the arc's first issue, Into the Unknown, in which it is destroyed. In this appearance, it is illustrated by Dario Carrasco, Jr. The Zeta Five is later mentioned, albeit indirectly, in the first issue of The Golden Age of the Sith's follow-up arc, Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi — The Fall of the Sith Empire.
